bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard, March 16, 1896
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General
Auditor for State and other Departments

div1.p: Legation of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, March 16, 1896.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. APR 22 1896 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Enclosing the agreement of Vice Consul B. Y. Payne.
Legation of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, March 16, 1896.
Hon. Auditor for State and other Departments, Washington D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to enclose the agreement between Vice Consul Beverly Y. Payne and myself.
You will see by this agreement his is permitted to draw the salary allowed him in my absence.
I am obediently William H. Heard Minister-Res. & Gen.
Agreement of Vice Consul Col B. Y. Payne

The following Agreement is this day entered into between William H. Heard United States Minister Resident and Consul General at Monrovia Republic of Liberia, of the First Part, and Beverly Y. Payne, United States Vice Consul General at Monrovia, Liberia of the Second Part.

The party of the First Part - being in bad health, and having obtained a Sixty (60) days Leave of absence, subject to the usual Statutory conditions to visit the United States, does on the day and date hereinafter mentioned, turn over the keys of the United States Legation and Consulate General at Monrovia, Liberia, with flags, arms, archive and furniture belonging thereto to the Party of the Second part, who, for and in consideration of the sum of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) per month to be drawn quarterly from the Secretary of State at Washington, D. C. United States of America by the Party of the Second part, does promise and agree to take charge of the said United States Legation and Consulate General at Monrovia Liberia, and keep safe and secure all flags, arms, archives and furniture thereunto belonging, during the period embraced in the above mentioned leave of absence and transmit of the Party of the First part in
accordance with the Consular Regulations governing Leaves of absence.
In witness whereof, the said Parties of the First and Second parts doe hereunto subscribe their names and affix the seal of the Consulate General at Monrovia, Liberia this 16 day of March, A.D. 1896.
William H. Heard Minister Res and Con General
Beverly Y. Payne Vice Consul General
